e5: In an ethical reporting policy, I would expect accuracy and honesty to be paramount. This would mean disclosing all pertinent information without manipulation or misrepresentation. In the context of corporate reporting, this could involve being transparent about any adjustments or modifications made to data, such as the earnings per share (EPS) scenario with ABC company. Considerations specific to investor relations highlight the need for policymakers to balance clarity and accuracy with investor awareness, demonstrating an ongoing effort to educate stakeholders about policy nuances. This ensures market perceptions are aligned with reporting reality.
e6: Yes. Ensuring that any potential benefits to transparency are balanced against this risk of confusing stakeholders seems crucial before making any final recommendations on updating reporting practices.
